docs.snippet: The Latest on Facebook's burgeoning privacy scandal (all times local):

headline.print_headline: The Latest: Facebook Ending Ad Targeting Using Outside Data
headline.main: The Latest: Facebook Ending Ad Targeting Using Outside Data

docs.snippet: U.S. regulators and state attorneys general are increasing pressure on Facebook as they probe whether the company's data-collection practices have hurt the people who use its services.

headline.print_headline: FTC, States Increase Pressure on Facebook on Privacy
headline.main: FTC, States Increase Pressure on Facebook on Privacy

docs.snippet: Virginia's Republican Party has kicked out a leader who posted a Facebook comment that indicated he would not vote for a Jewish candidate.

headline.print_headline: Virginia GOP Leader Booted for Anti-Semitic Facebook Post
headline.main: Virginia GOP Leader Booted for Anti-Semitic Facebook Post

docs.snippet: The leading U.S. consumer protection regulator and attorneys representing 37 states stepped up pressure on Facebook Inc on Monday to explain how the social network allowed data of 50 million users get into the hands of a political consultancy.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Regulator, State Attorneys Look for Answers From Facebook
headline.main: U.S. Regulator, State Attorneys Look for Answers From Facebook

docs.snippet: The leading U.S. consumer protection regulator and attorneys representing 37 states stepped up pressure on Facebook Inc on Monday to explain how the social network allowed data of 50 million users get into the hands of a political consultancy.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Regulator, State Attorneys Look for Answers From Facebook
headline.main: U.S. Regulator, State Attorneys Look for Answers From Facebook

docs.snippet: Facebook Inc, responding to reports in some technology industry media that it has been logging users' call and text history without their permission, said in a statement on Sunday that the function "has always been opt-in only."

headline.print_headline: Facebook: Call, Text History Logging Requires Users' Permission
headline.main: Facebook: Call, Text History Logging Requires Users' Permission

docs.snippet: The leading U.S. consumer protection regulator and attorneys representing 37 states stepped up pressure on Facebook Inc on Monday to explain how the social network allowed data of 50 million users get into the hands of a political consultancy.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Regulator, State Attorneys Look for Answers From Facebook
headline.main: U.S. Regulator, State Attorneys Look for Answers From Facebook

docs.snippet: The Latest on reports that millions of Facebook users' data was used to target political ads (all times local):

headline.print_headline: The Latest: Illinois County Sues Facebook for Fraud
headline.main: The Latest: Illinois County Sues Facebook for Fraud

docs.snippet: As questions mounted last year about whether Facebook had been exploited to tilt the U.S. presidential election, Mark Zuckerberg's to-do list landed him on a fishing trawler off Alabama's Gulf coast.

headline.print_headline: Is Zuckerberg Willing to Act Boldly to Fix Facebook Crisis?
headline.main: Is Zuckerberg Willing to Act Boldly to Fix Facebook Crisis?

docs.snippet: Three users of the Facebook Messenger app sued Facebook on Tuesday, saying the social network violated their privacy by collecting logs of their phone calls and text messages, in the latest legal challenge facing the company.

headline.print_headline: Three Facebook Users Sue Over Collection of Call, Text History
headline.main: Three Facebook Users Sue Over Collection of Call, Text History
